identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy of Acetaminophen Alone Versus Combination of Acetaminophen/Ibuprofen After Cesarean Section
identificationModule.officialTitle: Efficacy of Intravenous Acetaminophen Alone Versus Combination of Acetaminophen/Ibuprofen (Maxigesic速IV) in Multimodal Analgesia After Cesarean Section: a Randomized Controlled Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The investigators aim to compare the analgesic efficacy of intravenous acetaminophen alone versus combination of acetaminophen/ibuprofen (Maxigesic速IV) in multimodal analgesia after cesarean section.

interventions.name: Acetaminophen
interventions.description: 1g acetaminophen is administered during skin closure (end of operation).

interventions.name: Acetaminophen/Ibuprofen
interventions.description: A mixture of 1g acetaminophen and 300 mg ibuprofen (Maxigesic速IV) is administered during skin closure (end of operation)

interventions.name: Acetaminophen
interventions.description: 1g acetaminophen is administered 6 hours after the first administration.

interventions.name: Acetaminophen/Ibuprofen
interventions.description: A mixture of 1g acetaminophen and 300 mg ibuprofen (Maxigesic速IV) is administered 6 hours after the first administration.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Obstetric QoR-11K score 24 hours after end of surgery
primaryOutcomes.description: Minimum 0, poor recovery; maximum 110, good recovery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Numeric rating scale pain score (0-10) 4 hours after end of surgery
Numeric rating scale pain score (0-10) 8 hours after end of surgery
Numeric rating scale pain score (0-10) 12 hours after end of surgery
Numeric rating scale pain score (0-10) 24 h after end of surgery
Numeric rating scale pain score (0-10) 48 hours after end of surgery
Use of patient-controlled analgesia (FTN, micrograms) during the first 24 hours after end of surgery
Use of patient-controlled analgesia (FTN, micrograms) during the first 48 hours after end of surgery
Use of rescue analgesia during the first 24 hours after end of surgery
Use of rescue analgesia during the first 48 hours after end of surgery
Wound-related complications during hospital stay, up to 5 days
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From end of surgery to patient discharge, up to 5 days
After arrival at the operating room
After arrival at the operating room

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sensory blockade level by time point
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 0, 5, 10 minutes after intrathecal injection and at the end of operation

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients scheduled for elective cesarean section
* Gestational age \> 37+0 weeks

Exclusion Criteria:

* Emergency cesarean section
* Multiple pregnancy (e.g. twins, triplets)
* Body weight \< 50 kg
* Preeclampsia
* History of hypersensitivity to acetaminophen or ibuprofen
* History of upper gastrointestinal tract bleeding or gastric ulcer
* Underlying liver disease
* Underlying kidney disease or GFR \< 90 mL/min/1.73m2
* Heart failure or severe hypertension
* History of asthma
* Chronic use of barbital or tricyclic antidepressants
